text.p: BUDAPEST, Oct 1 (Oct 1) - Here are highlights of stories reported by Hungary's press, based on information by Nepszabadsag's Hungary Around the Clock service. For further details on how to subscribe to Hungary Around the Clock, please contact Monica Kovacs at (361) 351 2440 or fax your request to (361) 351 7141. @
ALL PAPERS

- Prime Minister Gyula Horn said that he had commissioned the Government Supervisory Bureau to investigate the matter of a lawyer, who has received over 300 million forints from the State Privatisation and Holding Co for her services in negotiating with local governments regarding land claims. He added he still has confidence in Industry and Trade Minister Tamas Suchman. @

- When receiving a delegation of the largest Japanese company executives, Prime Minister Gyula Horn urged more reciprocity in Hungarian-Japanese trade yesterday, as Hungary exports to Japan less than one-fifth of what it imports from that country.
- President Arpad Goncz yesterday awarded the Medium Cross Order of Merit of the Republic of Hungary to violinist and conductor Yehudi Menuhin.
- Parliament opened a general debate on a nuclear energy bill on Monday. @
- Students are expected to hold a demonstration today against tuition fees.
- A complaints' committee was formed by the National Radio and Television Commission yesterday.

- The general meeting of Takarekbank elected former head of the State Privatisation and Holding Co. Attila Lascsik to its board of directors yesterday and is expected to become president of the bank in the near future.
- Industry and Trade Minister Tamas Suchman and leaders of Danubius Hotels signed the sales contract for the Hungaria Hotels chain yesterday. @
- Compensation coupons can be exchanged for shares of the South Transdanubian electricity supply company Dedasz from October 7-24.
NAPI GAZDASAG
- Attila Karoly Soos, political state secretary at the Ministry of Industry and Trade, stepped down yesterday.
- After the first one per cent drop on July 1, the customs surcharge drops again today, from seven per cent to six per cent. @
VILAGGAZDASAG
- The Hungarian Television Shareholding Co is to be formed today.
MAGYAR HIRLAP
- President Arpad Goncz along with several ministries' senior representatives and a number of businessmen begins a three-day official visit to Sweden today.
- Romania's lower house of parliament decided yesterday to put the ratification of the Romanian-Hungarian basic treaty on its agenda at its present session. @
- A new, small bank named Magyar Cetelem Rt. will open early next year, according to an agreement signed last weekend by the French bank Cetelem and the Hungarian Investment and Development Bank.
- From November 1, the telephone number for ambulances will change from 04 to 104, that of firefighters from 05 to 105 and the police from 07 to 107. @
MAGYAR NEMZET
- The Foundation for the Protection of the Copyright of Audiovisual Artists destroyed nearly 13,000 bootleg videocassettes on Monday.
-- Budapest newsroom (36-1) 327 4040
